title: Make all Champs Free In ARAM?
body:
I think allowing all players to receive ANY champion randomly would make this game mode interesting, especially for lower leveled players. It would highlight the experimentation aspect of ARAM and make it more fun, taking your chances and possibly landing a champion you've never played before, or maybe just receiving a champ you owned. This would allow players to experiment more.
EDIT: Edited to clarify/explain more in depth

There's this odd thing that human perception of randomness is not the same as mathematical randomness.  Humans don't consider runs of the same result to be random, whereas the only requirement from a mathematical perspective is that you can't predict the next result given all previous results (and possibly all future results after that next result if you need it to be cryptographically secure).

Yes. I have been playing ARAM for quite some time only, and whether a champion is good on ARAM affects whether I will buy him, which should not be the case.

Let me float something by you, as an example.

I hate Shaco. I hate his theme/voice/kit/visuals/whatever. Because of this- I have not purchased him. I have no desire or intent to ever play him.

Now, why should I buy him? There is no benefit to me for doing so except to say, "I own Shaco." Or, "I own all champions."

You have control over your champ pool. Nobody makes you buy all the champions.

That is a small sacrifice I am willing to take to remove the toxic ARAM accounts from existence.

You can still reroll after all.

That's another thing- the bias that there's a lot of ARAM-only accounts.
Frequently, this is based on the view that there's too many times a 'good' ARAM champ surfaces in a game.
However, this has some flaws.

For starts, I routinely play ARAM and have most of the champion pool, I still usually get good ARAM champions. Not by a small margin either- by a hefty one- way more often than not. I don't believe the random system is 100% random. I think it takes other variables into account.
Furthermore, you **should** see good ARAM champions more. That's what the reroll you mentioned is for. That means you should inherently see more champions good at ARAM than bad.
